title: Ebola Teams Train To Respond To New U.S. Cases At A Moment's Notice
teaser: The CDC and Pentagon are both training "go-teams" that can be on the ground within days of an Ebola diagnosis in the U.S. Team members learn about containing infection and dealing with the stress, but it's unclear how these crews will work with each other.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
